result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Allen Castner #520158 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Delivery of Methamphetamine - PTAC, As a Party to a Crime, Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Felony Bail Jumping, Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, Repeater [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Tremp. Co. Case No. 14 CF 93.  04-15-16: Court orders extended supervision be reduced from 3 years to 2 years and 6 months.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.
